itemListElement.name: Methi Thepla – High Protein Savory Herbed Flatbread. Yeast-free

@graph.name: Methi Thepla - High Protein Savory Herbed Flatbread
@graph.description: Methi Thepla - High protein Savory flatbread with chickpea flour, quinoa flour, coconut flour, sesame seeds. Vegan Soy-free yeast-free. Can be made gluten-free.
recipeIngredient: 1/4 cup quinoa flour (or use more chickpea flour)
2 tbsp oat flour (or use whole wheat flour)
2 Tbsp coconut flour (or use soy flour or more chickpea flour)
2 tbsp flax seeds or flax seed meal (optional)
1 tsp red chili flakes  (or to taste)
3 to 4 Tbsp dried fenugreek leaves (kasoori methi or 1/2 cup packed finely chopped fresh fenugreek leaves)

recipeInstructions.text: in a large bowl mix all the dry ingredients and mix well.
recipeInstructions.name: in a large bowl mix all the dry ingredients and mix well.

recipeInstructions.text: In a blender, blend the yogurt, water, ginger and chili. Or grate ginger and chili and add to the dry bowl. Add the rest of the ingredients to the bowl and mix until a dough is formed. Add a tsp or so more water if too dry, or add a tbsp more chickpea flour if too soft and sticky.
recipeInstructions.name: In a blender, blend the yogurt, water, ginger and chili. Or grate ginger and chili and add to the dry bowl. Add the rest of the ingredients to the bowl and mix until a dough is formed. Add a tsp or so more water if too dry, or add a tbsp more chickpea flour if too soft and sticky.

recipeInstructions.text: Spray oil on the dough, Cover and let it sit for 20 to 30 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Spray oil on the dough, Cover and let it sit for 20 to 30 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Oil your hands and knead for a minute to smooth out the dough. The dough will be somewhat stiff but should not be too stiff to knead or too sticky.
recipeInstructions.name: Oil your hands and knead for a minute to smooth out the dough. The dough will be somewhat stiff but should not be too stiff to knead or too sticky.

recipeInstructions.text: Divide the dough into equal sized balls. Cover the balls with a towel while you roll.
recipeInstructions.name: Divide the dough into equal sized balls. Cover the balls with a towel while you roll.

recipeInstructions.text: Take each ball and using wheat flour or chickpea flour, roll it out into 7 inch rounds. Do not worry about the shape. Just roll the flatbread so it is generally even thickness. Roll out the rest and keep covered with towel.
recipeInstructions.name: Take each ball and using wheat flour or chickpea flour, roll it out into 7 inch rounds. Do not worry about the shape. Just roll the flatbread so it is generally even thickness. Roll out the rest and keep covered with towel.

recipeInstructions.text: Cook over medium heat. Cook for 30 seconds, then flip. Cook for 30 seconds. Spray or spread a little oil on the flatbread and flip. Cook for another 30 seconds, spray oil on the current side, flip and cook again until golden brown spots . Cook all of the flatbreads. Store on the counter for upto 2 days.
recipeInstructions.name: Cook over medium heat. Cook for 30 seconds, then flip. Cook for 30 seconds. Spray or spread a little oil on the flatbread and flip. Cook for another 30 seconds, spray oil on the current side, flip and cook again until golden brown spots . Cook all of the flatbreads. Store on the counter for upto 2 days.
